intro: Hieracium pergracile, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Hieracium pergracile is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
